Class PartitionAlgorithm

java.lang.Object
PartitionAlgorithm.PartitionAlgorithm
Direct Known Subclasses:
BF, BFD, FF, FFD, None, SBP, WF, WFD
public abstract class PartitionAlgorithm extends Object
Abstract base class for partition algorithms used to allocate tasks to cores.

This class provides a common abstraction for different partitioning strategies that assign tasks from a TaskSet to available Core objects (possibly represented by Processor containers). Implementations of this abstract class should implement taskToCore(Vector, TaskSet) to perform the actual partitioning and assignment logic.

Author:
ShiuJia

  • Method Details

    • setName

      public void setName(String n)
      Sets the name of the partition algorithm.

      Use this to give a human-readable identifier to the algorithm (for logging, reporting or UI purposes).

      Parameters:
      n - the name to be set for the algorithm

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Retrieves the name of the partition algorithm.

      Returns the name previously set via setName(String), or null if no name has been set.

      Returns:
      the name of the algorithm, or null if not set

    • taskToCore

      public abstract void taskToCore(Vector<Core> cores, TaskSet taskSet)
      Abstract method for assigning tasks to cores.

      Implementations should partition tasks from the provided taskSet among the provided cores. The partitioning strategy (best-fit, first-fit, worst-fit, etc.) is determined by concrete subclasses. The method is expected to modify the cores and/or tasks as needed to reflect the assignment.

      Parameters:
      cores - a Vector of Core objects representing the cores to which tasks can be assigned
      taskSet - the TaskSet containing tasks to be partitioned among the cores
